Lonely Road #145 A Helping Hand

Posted on March 22, 2014 by mike

I had the pleasure of working with a totally beautiful woman named Monica for one of my Lonely Road photo shoots. And, like so many of the gals I did work with on this project, Monica was a bit new to modeling. But, man oh man oh man, this gal ROCKED. No hesitancy, smiles galore with all of my “interesting” photo suggestions…..and simply a joy in being in front of the camera. And, amidst all the fun she and I had that day……IÂ  realize that I could create a blog entry simply focused on the props Monica and I worked with that day. Because, in our attempt to take playful, sexy, quirky, semi-nude and sort-of-funny “Lonely Road” photos…..I think you’ll get a kick out of the types of THINGS we incorporated into her shots. So…..hmm….ready to get started?

Monica is naturally gorgeous. How ’bout this stunning lady in a sexy, skin-tight dress:

I mean OMG….how could she not have done more modeling? Such a fabulous smile, amazing figure….I just felt she was perfect when I met her. Anyway, people…Goodwill offers AMAZING clothing…if you’re unaware. In fact…where do you think this awesome dress came from? Well, Monica looks smashing in it…right? So, as a prop you could simply say this is a lovely addition. But, what if this dress also had a killer, low, scoop-back that could offer a completely different perspective from behind:

Hah! Now…that’s a “Lonely Road” photo! And, when it comes to finding outfits and props for my project, I really looked for items that could enhance a photo as well as properly accessorize my model! So, this dress was perfect!! Glamour on one hand and wacky/sexy on the other! But, this dress and Monica’s killer, tanlined,Â bare ass peeking from it is only the start of my prop entry!

What about a scarf?

I love how intense her expression is here. And, in a b&w photo, the black scarf offers nice contrast against her blond hair and bare skin. But, what if she ONLY could use that scarf to cover her entire body? Yeah…..no hands. Hmm…how do you think that would work as a prop?? Well….you be the judge:

I love this…..especially her laughter! And, she did a fabulous job of covering all of her most private areas with this black material. Well done, Monica!Â So, don’t forget….that when YOU decide to also pose for the Lonely Road project…you’re going to have a ton of fun too!

Our next prop was the oh-so-famous Chuck Taylor Converse All-Star tennis shoes! Yeah, I think most of us have owned a pair or two at some pointÂ in our lives, and Monica did remember to bring her pink Chucks to our shoot! So….how do you properly incorporate the Chucks Prop into a sexy, Lonely Road photo?Â Hmmm…..got some ideas? I mean….if the model only wears those you’re not covering up much. And, again, with my photosÂ I don’t just look for nudity. I want an additional element in the shots that involves motion or humor or something wacky. So….how about this:

YES…the ole’ Chuck toss! What do you think….something you’d be proud of?? Well, I sure am as I think a bit of silly in such a shot makes the photograph interesting. And, though your eyes will keep wandering back to Monica’s bare butt and those awesome tanlines, you can’t help but also wander back and forth from the pink shoe to the one flying in the air. Hence…a more complex and hopefully more interesting shot! May not be considered “art” by some stuffy NY critic, but, for me it’s fabulous.

Now…what if you were giving a prop of a wide, vivid blue belt and asked to incorporate that into your “look” and into a photograph as a prop? And, to make it challenging…what if you could NOT wear it around your waist? Well…..the stunning Monica sure made good use of it on her head:

She is also using her hands quite well for this sexy yet discreet photo….but, she and I both LOVED this blue belt. Monica had brought with her these vivid, blue rubber boots and I just happened to have this belt in my wardrobe to perfectly match it. So, now let’s see what she could do with the boots as well….and, a properly distanced cactus:

Those blues are awesome …though I think many viewers will focus more on Monica’s rear end. But, as far as props go, having some matching vivid colors to adorn both ends of her seemingly help move the viewers’ eyes around the photo. And, our attempt to mess with your perception of depth and distance…with her seemingly leaning on the cactus….hopefully intrigues you as well!

Aren’t tan lines fabulous? People, quit going to tanning beds and laying naked to AVOID them! They are sexy and wonderful and perfectly highlight a gorgeous ass like Monica’s. Do our world some justice and revive tan lines! Appreciate them like Playboy did in the 70’s!!!

Well, sticking with the blue belt/headband and matching rubber boots, Monica and I had a few more photograph ideas to attempt! And, look out, the first couple involve her facing the camera! Yup…how could I attempt to pull off a sexy and playful picture of her, full frontal, clad only in those blue accessories? Well…..what if I had her hold some Banana Boat suntan lotion inÂ  just the right spot to provide us a degree of decency:

SPF 15 does provide quality protection from the elements….wouldn’t you agree? Sunshine and those nasty rays it contains can be hazardous…especially in AZ and on the Lonely Road. So, despite Monica not wearing much, we tried to properly protect her lovely skin as best we could. But, rather than holding it in front of her _____, maybe we should have sprayed it on her? Well….rather than the Banana Boat, we had one other prop idea for a quite similar shot. But, in this shot,Â I think you’ll agree that the bottle she’s holding is more appropriate and works to properly advertise to the world what my Lonely Road project is all about:

Well said, Monica, well said! Accuracy with advertising is very important in today’s world….and, this lovely lady is the perfect billboard.

We still hadn’t tapped the blue belt/blue boot idea to death at this point and though I LOVED the Naked Juice prop, I still felt there might be something else I could include for Monica as a prop option. My hand. Yes….how wonderfully professional to let her use one of my hands to “accessorize” her look, right? Well….here you go:

Isn’t that the definition of class? LOL….I can’t remember if she or I laughed more at this idea…and you’ve gotta give Monica a hand for her willingness to agree to this shot! YES…shadows can be the ideal prop as well!

So, what else could remain for our prop entry? Oh, yes, our lovely Lonely Road model could spin around one more time….and…..we could attempt one more photograph with that hand/shadow prop:

Ah, yes, the visual definition of a HELPING HAND! And, if you want to see a similar shot of Monica, smile included, you might try purchasing my current calendar or the Lonely Road book! Come on……you need this kind of photography on your desk or dining table!!

Well……that about did if for Monica’s day on the Lonely Road. And, as we say goodbye to this spectacularly lovely lady and her props galore….how about one final shot of those boots and headband…..but with Monica’s own hands helping out this time:

The Lonely Road and Monica….a great team!
